Control.Text: This wizard will assist you in selecting a parsing plugin, configuring updates and selecting a log file.
Make certain that you select the proper plugin for the game you are playing. (Marked in bold red)

ACT by itself does not have any capability to parse game log files. You must use an external plugin to parse log files from different games. Browse the drop-down list and select a plugin to enable with the associated button. Do not enable more than one parsing plugin at a time.
Any time you switch characters ACT can detect a different log file being used and switch to it automatically.

Upon starting, exiting or character switching, ACT will attempt to rename the last open log file if it is larger than the listed size. This may require administrative privilages and will not work with files currently being written to.
This operation is merely for convenience of importing old files or opening them in text editors. There is no real-time performance consideration when changing this setting.

While Microsoft WinForms does not offer per-app theming, you may override certain colors. You may find the adjustable colors in the Options tab, Color and Font Settings, Main User Interface page. You may also ask ACT to forget all customizations or apply some sample colors for a more dark theme.
Certain parts of some controls cannot be re-colored and will always appear with system defined colors.
Changing some colors might not look correct until you restart ACT.
